data.name: ControlHelpText.Help
data.value: This is the Help Text displayed to the user to explain this field.

data.name: DeleteField.Text
data.value: Are you sure you wish to delete this column?

data.name: ModuleHelp.Text
data.value:
Form and List Configuration

The Form and List module stores its data inside a table. The table and its columns are defined by the user, which is the origin of the former name for this module: "User Defined Table". The following data types are available for defining columns:

  • Text
  • Rich Text (HTML)
  • Integer
  • Decimal
  • Date and Time
  • Date
  • Time
  • True/false
  • Email
  • Currency
  • URL Link
  • Image
  • User
  • Download
  • LookUp
  • Calculated Column

Individual columns can be configured visible only for site Administrator accounts or visible by specific Roles granted permission to see all columns. You can specify a column default value and designate if a value is required or optional.

For the default Grid Table Display Setting, column headings are also links that when clicked, reorder the column data alphanumerically from A-Z or Z-A. You can predefine a sorting column, and by specifying a page size, you may activate the built-in multi-paging controls. For type URL column, you can specify static link text, and for images, you may preset the maximum display size so all images get scaled proportionally to fit.

Quick Start: Setup Form and List

  1. Add a new instance of Form and List to an existing page;
  2. Select Form and List Configuration from the module's Action Menu;
  3. Click Add New Column;
  4. Enter a Title for the column that will be displayed as column header. Note that some special characters are not allowed in Title names;
  5. Choose the desired data Type for this column;
  6. (Optional) Enable Required if every record should contain data for this column;
  7. (Optional) Enable Visible if this column should be visible in List View for all users. If disabled, only Administrators and Roles granted module Permission Grid rights to Display All Columns will see this column in List View. Note that this setting only affects List View.
  8. (Optional) Enable Searchable if you wish the Module Search function to search this column.
  9. (Optional) Advanced Column Options allow you to specifically tailor each column with powerful added functionality. Click the Help tooltip (?) for more information on Advanced Column Options;
  10. Click Save Settings and Return.

More Features

  • Use the Move Column Up and Move Column Down arrows to determine the order of columns
  • Specify Columns Settings to manage popup browser windows and to control image sizing
  • Access Display Settings to choose options for advanced Rendering Method options including build-in XSL Transformation templates, or even use your own self made XSLT stylesheets 
  • Select the Sort Column and specific the Sort Direction (ascending/descending)
  • Activate multi-paging functionality by choosing a Paging value from the dropdown list
  • Select which CSS Classes should be applied to the Default Grid Display
  • Using SQL, you may choose to Filter which records will appear in this module instance
  • You may enable the Search function. Enable Show Search Box, then choose options to Show no records until Search and enable Simple Search to display only a Search Box (and help). Disable Simple Search for more detailed search conditional options

You can display Form and List data in any layout or format you choose using XML and XSL style sheets. The module includes a set of built in XSL Transformation (XSLT) files that you may use as a starting point to creating more advanced and customized XSLT of your own. XSL Transformations offer you maximum flexibility for presenting  your data.

Two very powerful options are available for helping you work with XSL transformations. These features are especially useful for debugging and learning more about XSL transformations syntax.

  1. Choose Display Settings > Rendering Method: XSLT using built-in stylesheets, then select a XSL File from the dropdown list
  2. Click Show XSL source code to view the XSL

-or-

  1. Choose Display Settings > Rendering Method: XSLT using self made stylesheets
  2. Click Generate New

data.name: plDnnCssClasses.Help
data.value: Specify which CSS classes will be assigned to the Default Grid Table.

data.name: plFilterDataSet.Help
data.value: Enter a filter expression which a record must match to be displayed,. If your column name has spaces or special characters, surround the column name with [brackets]. Example: [fieldname] ='value'.

data.name: plOrder.Help
data.value: Specify the default sort order direction, either Ascending (low to high) or Descending (high to low).

data.name: plPaging.Help
data.value: To enable paging, specify the number of items to display per page.

data.name: plRenderMethod.Help
data.value: Choose to display data using a Default Grid Table or by applying a self made or built-in XSL script.

data.name: plShowSearchTextBox.Help
data.value: Display a text box above the data grid to allow users to search for data in the columns specified as Searchable.

data.name: plSort.Help
data.value: Specify a default sort column. This sort order is overridden when the user clicks the heading of another column.

data.name: plURLFullPath.Help
data.value: Show full path, when displaying a link to an external URL, file with folders and tabs with path? Otherwise file name / page name is displayed only.

data.name: plUserDefinedStyleSheet.Help
data.value: Specify the location of an XSL file or create a new one.

data.name: plUsage.Help
data.value: List or Form mode, this setting applies to the current page only.

data.name: plSubmissionText.Help
data.value: Enter text to display to the user after the Form "Submit" is clicked.

data.name: ShowOnEdit.Help
data.value: If enabled, value will be displayed to all users when editing.

data.name: SpecialCharactersInFieldTitle.ErrorMessage
data.value: Column title contains special characters like "*", ":", "," or "?"

data.name: UniqueFieldName.ErrorMessage
data.value: Column title has to be unique

data.name: GenerateXsl.Action
data.value: Generate XSL Stylesheet using a Token language

data.name: plShowNoRecordsUntilSearch.Help
data.value: Enable to display no records until a search is performed. Click the Search link with no criteria to display all records.

data.name: plSimpleSearch.Help
data.value: Enable a simple, single field search.

data.name: plTrackingEmailAddresses.Help
data.value: Enter one or more email addresses, separated by semicolon ";" or enclosed in [brackets]. You may enter the column Title name for column types Email, Created By, Changed By, User Link, e.g. admin@domain.com;[Created By];[Secondary Email]

data.name: plTrackingMessage.Help
data.value: Enter the body of the notification email message.

data.name: plEmailSubject.Help
data.value: Enter a Subject for the notification email. You can also use [field:columnname] or commen [tokens] within the Subject field.

data.name: plBody.Help
data.value: The body of the email can be created automatically using the message and text fields above or created by a self made customizable XSL script.

data.name: plTrackingOn.Help
data.value: Choose which actions will trigger a notification email.

data.name: plTrackingScript.Help
data.value: Specify the location of a XSL file or create a new one.

data.name: DeleteAll.Confirm
data.value: Are you sure you wish to delete all records stored in this table?

data.name: ResetModuleTabSettings.Confirm
data.value: Are you sure you wish to reset all page related settings for this module?

data.name: plURLSearch.Help
data.value: Enable this setting to include URL paths in search.

data.name: plTopCount.Help
data.value: If you want to limit the number of records returned, enter a number between 1 and 1000 and only the first records will be displayed (according to Sorting Options).

data.name: ErrTopCount.Text
data.value: Please enter a valid integer number between 1 and 1000!

data.name: RememberSettings.Text
data.value: Please apply also "Create Record/Submit Form" permissions in Module Settings!

data.name: plOnDelete.Help
data.value: Optional message to display in the body of the notification email, on Delete.

data.name: plOnNew.Help
data.value: Optional message to display in the body of the notification email, on New.

data.name: plOnUpdate.Help
data.value: Optional message to display in the body of the notification email, on Update.

data.name: NotEmailSource.Text
data.value: Tracking/Notification issue: Field {0} is either not a valid source for email adresses or it was not found inside fields definitions.

data.name: UdtTeaser.Text
data.value: Specify the "User Defined Table" columns you wish to include in your Form or List.

data.name: lblOnSubmissionRedirect.Help
data.value: Page or URL you want to redirect the user after submission

data.name: NotEmailAddress.Text
data.value: Tracking/Notification issue: {0} is not a valid email address. If you want to add a field, please surround your input with square brackets.

data.name: plEnableListViewPermission.Help
data.value: By default, List is shown if "Form above List" or "Form below List" is selected. If this setting is enabled, it is controlled by "List View" permission. In "Form" mode, the permission will control also the module action "Show Records".

data.name: plEnableListViewPermission.Text
data.value: Is List view restricted by Permission?

data.name: plTrackingEmail_BCC.Help
data.value: Enter one or more email addresses, separated by semicolon ";" or enclosed in [brackets]. You may enter the column Title name for column types Email, Created By, Changed By, User Link, e.g. admin@domain.com;[Created By];[Secondary Email]

data.name: plTrackingEmail_CC.Help
data.value: Enter one or more email addresses, separated by semicolon ";" or enclosed in [brackets]. You may enter the column Title name for column types Email, Created By, Changed By, User Link, e.g. admin@domain.com;[Created By];[Secondary Email]

data.name: plPrivacy.Help
data.value: Enable this setting to keep the data of this modul confidential, When enabled, data will be excluded from the website search index.

data.name: DataTypeNotInstalled.Text
data.value: DataType "{0}" is not installed. Please either check DataTypes.Config or change the type of the matching fields.

data.name: EditStyle.Help
data.value: Style which is applied on text box or list control in form, e.g. "width:300px"

data.name: plTrackingEmail_from.Help
data.value: Sender email address for the notification message. Only set a value if you know exactly what you are doing! Customizing this setting, you risk the chance that notification emails will be treated as unsolicited SPAM. ReplyTo is the safest option to customize for most situations. If you are unsure, leave this setting blank and the email address of the portal administrator will be used.

data.name: plTrackingEmail_replyto.Help
data.value: Email address used to reply to the notification message. If you are unsure, leave this setting blank and the email address of the portal administrator will be used.

data.name: plUseButtons.Help
data.value: Actions as Buttons instead of ActionMenu commands

data.name: EnableFormTemplate.Help
data.value: Override the rendering of the form.

data.name: FormTemplate.Help
data.value: The template is set as html. To insert labels, use the [label-for:Fieldname] token, for the input fields [editor-for:Fieldname], for the captcha use [editor-for:Security Code]
